At times a registrar (junior doctor) may work at Kaipara Medical Centre

A registrar doctor is fully qualified, sometimes with years of experience in a hospital. The 5-month long placement with the Medical Centre is to enable the doctor to experience the varied cases that are part of rural practice. The registrar is supervised and mentored by the senior staff. The placement forms part of their ongoing education so that at the end of a year they will be ready to sit the exams for the first part of the specialist GP qualification.

When visiting the Centre, you may be asked if you would mind being seen by the registrar. He or she will have full access to your medical notes on the computer and will always refer to your own GP or senior staff member, if necessary. You will never be pressured into seeing them, if you would prefer to visit your usual Doctor.

AFTER HOURS: If you phone the surgery after hours (after 5pm or at the weekend), the surgery may be closed but your call will be diverted to a triage nurse, who will then contact the duty doctor if required. Note: This doctor may be at Helensville, Waimauku, Huapai or Kumeū and may not have full access to your records. The triage nurse cannot answer questions from your records or make appointments. Please telephone in normal working hours. Also ask about Manage My Health, our secure online portal that allows you to communicate with the practice after hours.

notesHtml: VACCINATIONS FOR TAMARIKI AGED 5 - 11 YEARS
Te Kāika will be offering vaccinations to children aged 5 - 11 years old with consent from their parent or legal guardian. No bookings necessary. We are open Wednesday to Sundays, 8:30AM - 4PM.
4 MONTH COVID-19 VACCINATION BOOSTERS

Following the Government announcement on 21/12/21, Te Kāika will be providing boosters 4 months after your second primary dose (or third dose for immuno-compromised) . We recommend just driving in to receive your booster.
ASTRA ZENECA VACCINE
We are currently not offering Astra Zeneca at Te Kāika.
TE KĀIKA COVID-19 CALL CENTRE
For any other enquiries regarding boosters or vaccinations for tamariki through Te Kāika, you can call our team directly on 0800 847 862.

AFTER HOURS
In an emergency, please dial 111.
If you need medical advice after hours please call (09) 278 2578 and your call will be answered by NZ Registered Nurses. This service is only available for our enrolled patient only.
Alternatively,
When we are closed or unavailable, you can get a virtual (online) GP consultation with a doctor from the comfort of your own home, workplace, or anywhere via UnifyHealth (7am-9pm, 7 days).
All you need to do is type in book.unifyhealth.co.nz into a web browser on your smart phone or computer. You will then be guided through the steps to booking a doctor online.
*Please be aware this Unifyhealth service incur a charge. Enrolled patients at Papatoetoe Family Doctors will only be charged what they are normally charged at this practice.

Our phones are switched over to Homecare Medical (HML) each week day at 5.30pm (or at the scheduled close time).  HML is available for medical advice after hours, on week nights, public holidays and all weekend on 278-2578.

notesHtml: We also offer a flexible payment scheme that allows you to pay a little each week so you get access to healthcare when you need it.
PUBLIC HOLIDAYS:
We are closed on Public Holidays.
AFTER HOURS:
If you ring our phone number after hours your call will be answered by a nurse at Homecare Medical Limited and she will be able to help you.

If one of our doctors is not available or it is after-hours you can get a virtual GP consultation with a real doctor from the comfort of your own home, workplace, holiday house or anywhere by using CareHQ, from 7am – 7pm, 7 days per week. Find out more www.carehq.co.nz
URGENT:
If your need is urgent please ring the surgery and speak with the nurse who will advise what to do.
In a life threatening situation call the Ambulance 111.

notesHtml: Please note that we do not provide free after-hours medical care for accident and emergencies. The nearest free accident and emergency clinic is at Whangārei Hospital. Fees are expensive for after-hours care as they involve calling a doctor out from home. We strongly advise where possible that you see a doctor during the day.
We are open from 9 - 12 on public holidays for emergencies only.

If you need to attend the Urgent Doctors Centre, please ask for a copy of the medical notes from your visit to be sent to us at the Kelston Medical Centre.
For after hours telephone advice on health care, you can also ring the national Health Line on 0800 611 116 for a free telephone call to a registered nurse.

notesHtml: Devonport Family Medicine is a well-established medical centre that has serviced the local Devonport community for many years.
Dr Veenhuijsen is available full-time for consultations and an experienced female General Practitioner is also working in the practice part-time.

Devonport Family Medicine offers patients greater accessibility to see their own doctor by providing same-day and advance appointments and a personalised and co-ordinated care approach through doctor-patient continuity.
After hours please phone (09) 445 0528 (24/7) where you will be advised of after hours services.

If one of our doctors is not available or it is after hours you can get a virtual GP consultation with a real doctor from the comfort of your home, workplace, holiday house or anywhere by using CareHQ, from 7 am - 7 pm, 7 days per week.  Find out more www.carehq.co.nz

notesHtml: We are closed all public holidays and every weekend. Please note we close at 4pm the day before a public holiday.
On normal week days our phones switch on at 8am each weekday and turn off at 5pm Monday to Friday; and 4pm the night before a public holiday.

Patients are requested to always ring and book an appointment with your nurse or doctor.
For repeat prescription requests and lab results or to book an appointment please use our online patient portal.

Our nurses are often not able to immediately take your call as they care for the patients with booked appointments. If you wish to have a call back from a nurse please ask reception to put your name on the nurse queue. The nurses will then ring you as soon as they are able.
PLEASE RING HEALTHLINE 0800 611 116 FOR GENERAL HEALTH INFORMATION.

After-hours Telephone Consultation: 09 294 3005

Your after-hours calls are redirected to the Homecare Medical nurse triage service which provides a free after-hours telephone consultation with a registered nurse. When necessary, the HML nurse may advise you to go to an urgent after-hour's accident and medical centre for care (see below).
For a medical emergency please call 111 immediately!

Hawke's Bay COVID-19 Vaccine Information - Hawkes Bay District Health Board – Our Health (ourhealthhb.nz)

Getting a COVID-19 vaccine is an important step you can take to protect yourself, your kaumātua and whānau from the effects of the virus. For more information on the COVID-19 vaccines and eligibility visit Ministry of Health - COVID-19 vaccines

The majority of routine vaccinations can now be administered before, after, or at the same time as your COVID-19 vaccinations. The exception to this is the Zostavax (shingles) vaccine where a 7-day gap before or after receiving the Pfizer COVID-19 is advised. If you have any questions, please discuss with your healthcare provider.
